page.title: 05Stodmarsh, Wickhambreaux.
page.content: {Stodmarsh}is a small village about five miles away from{Canterbury.} {Stodmarsh}got its name after the monks of{Canterbury}had a stud farm there, where they bred horses; the marsh bit comes from the marsh around {Stodmarsh. Stodmarsh}has a very high water table and now people cannot be buried in the church yard because their coffins would just float up again. Over the years{Stodmarsh's population has got smaller; in 1841 there was a population of 145 but now there are only 76 people. {Stodmarsh}is quiet with one post office which sells most general things but there is only one snag and that is that it is only open on{Tuesday}and {Thursday}afternoons, for{eight hours a {week.}Once there was a bakery which was owned by{Samuel Baker.
